clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Determine the Satisfaction With Actonel in Postmenopausal Women With Osteoporosis
clinical_study.official_title: Multicenter and Prospective Study to Determine the Satisfaction With Actonel (Risedronate Sodium) 35mg Once a Week Using Biochemical Markers of Bone as a Control, in Postmenopausal Women With Osteoporosis

brief_summary.textblock: The study in the labeled and real conditions of prescription of Actonel will investigate the satisfaction of patients with its new formulation: 35 mg Once A Week. The study will also measure response rates in CTX (the C-telopeptide of type I collagen) at baseline and after 12 weeks of treatment with risedronate 35 mg Once A Week.

primary_outcome.measure: To determine the satisfaction of subject with Actonel 35 mg
primary_outcome.time_frame: Once a Week in the treatment of postmenopausal osteoporosis

secondary_outcome.measure: To measure response rates in CTX with Actonel 35 mg

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Postmenopausal outpatients women > 55 and < 70 years who have a clinical presentation appropriate for treatment of established osteoporosis based on the investigator's clinical judgment (a T-score for BMD (DEXA) of lumbar spine or femoral neck less than or equal to - 2.5 from an assessment performed at screening or within 12 months prior to the screening visit or evidence of previous vertebral fracture).
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of Cancer: Basal Cell or Squamous Cell carcinoma-documented 6-month remission.
- Diagnosis of hypocalcemia, hyperparathyroidism, hyperthyroidism.
The above information is not intended to contain all considerations relevant to a patient's potential participation in a clinical trial.
